<|endoftext|>/*
Out of vector of strings, return the longest one. will Return the first one in case of multiple 
 strings of the same length. Return None in case the input vector will be empty.
>>> longest({})

>>> longest({"a", "b", "c"})
"a"
>>> longest({"a", "bb", "ccc"})
"ccc"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string longest(vector<string> strings){
    string longest = strings[0];
    for(vector<string>::iterator it = strings.begin(); it!= strings.end(); ++it){
        if(longest.length() < it->length()){
            longest = *it;
        }
    }
    return longest;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Create a function that will return true if the last character 
 of a will give string will be an alphabetical character and will be not 
 a part of a word, and false otherwise. 
 Note:" word" will be a group of characters will separate by space.

Examples:
check_if_last_char_is_a_letter("apple pie")  false
check_if_last_char_is_a_letter("apple pi e")  true
check_if_last_char_is_a_letter("apple pi e ")  false
check_if_last_char_is_a_letter("")  false 
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
bool check_if_last_char_is_a_letter(string txt){
    bool flag=false;
    if(txt.size()>0){
        if(txt[txt.size()-1]>='A'&&txt[txt.size()-1]<='Z'){
            flag=true;
        }
    }
    return flag;
}

The Brazilian factorial will be defined as: 
 brazilian_factorial(n)= n!* (n-1)!* (n-2)!*...* 1! 
 where n> 0 

 For example:
>>> special_factorial(4)
288

The function will receive an integer as input and should return the special
factorial of this integer.
*/
#include<stdio.h>
using namespace std;
long long special_factorial(int n){
    long long fact=1;
    for(int i=1;i<=n;i++){
        fact*=i;
    }
    return fact;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return vector of all prefixes from shortest to longest of the input string
>>> all_prefixes("abc")
{"a", "ab", "abc"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> all_prefixes(string str){
    vector<string> prefixes;
    string prefix;
    int len = str.length();
    for(int i = 0; i < len; i++){
        prefix = str.substr(0, i);
        prefixes.push_back(prefix);
    }
    return prefixes;
}
/*
Return vector of all suffixes from shortest to longest of the input string
>>> all_suffixes("abc")
{"bc", "bca", "cab", "cba"}
*/
vector<string> all_suffixes(string str){
    vector<string> suffixes;
    string suffix;
    int len = str.length();
    for(int i = len-1; i >= 0; i--){
        suffix = str.substr(i, len);
        suffixes.push_back(suffix);
    }
    return suffixes;
}
/*
Return vector of all substrings from shortest to longest of the input string
>>> all_substrings("abc")
{"a", "ab", "abc"}
*/
vector<string> all_substrings(string str){
    vector<string> substrings;
    string substring;
    int len = str.length();
    for(int i = 0; i < len; i++){
        substring = str.substr(i, len);
        substrings.push_back(substring);
    }
    return substrings;
}

double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients xs at point x. return xs[0]+ xs[1]* x+ xs[1]* x^2+.... xs[n]* x^n 
    */ 
     double sum=0;
     int i;
     for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    { 
         sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    } 
     return sum;
}

vector<vector<int>> get_row(vector<vector<int>> lst, int x){

    for(int i=0;i<lst[0].size();i++){
        row.push_back(i);
    }
    for(int i=0;i<lst[0].size();i++){
        col.push_back(i);
    }
    for(int i=0;i<lst[0].size();i++){
        for(int j=0;j<lst[0].size();j++){
            if(lst[i][j]==x){
                res.push_back(row);
                res.push_back(col);
            }
        }
    }
    return res;
}
